Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Axillary Lymph Node Dissection Omission in Mastectomy Patients with Sentinel Lymph Node Metastases

Participants.evidence: patients with histologically confirmed invasive BC, tumour size ≤5 cm, cN0, and ≤2 metastatic SLNs

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned (1:1) to ALND followed by adjuvant treatment (standard arm) or adjuvant treatment alone (experimental arm)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was overall survival (OS) and the secondary endpoint was recurrence-free survival (RFS), assessed over a median follow-up of 33.0 months

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 218 patients were randomised: 111 to the ALND group and 107 to the SLNB-only group

Result_Outcome.evidence: the 5-year OS rates were 97.8% in the ALND arm and 98.7% in the SLNB-only arm (P = 0.597)
